function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Use of multiple regression to estimate the growth rate of infections","Impact":"Misinterpretation of coefficients could lead to inaccurate understanding of infection growth factors","Mitigation":"Incorporate additional data sources and conduct sensitivity analysis","Technologies":"Statistical software for regression analysis","People":"Researchers, analysts","Owner":"Research team, data analysts"},{"Description":"Omitting day-of-week effects in China due to the timing of COVID-19 outbreak","Impact":"Inaccurate modeling of weekly patterns in infection growth rates","Mitigation":"Consider alternative methods to account for weekly patterns specific to China","Technologies":"Statistical software for regression analysis","People":"Researchers, analysts familiar with Chinese context","Owner":"Research team, data analysts"},{"Description":"Incorporating single-day dummy variables for abrupt changes in COVID-19 testing availability","Impact":"Potential misinterpretation of the effects of testing availability on infection rates","Mitigation":"Conduct sensitivity analysis and consider alternative methods to capture testing effects","Technologies":"Statistical software for regression analysis","People":"Researchers, analysts","Owner":"Research team, data analysts"}]}
